title: Man jailed for killing roommate with hammer and hiding her in a wall for six years
text:
Randolph Garbutt (left) was sentenced to 11 years in jail for the murder of Raven Campbell (Picture: Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department)

A killer who beat his roommate to death with a hammer and hid her in a wall for six years was sentenced to jail.

Randoph Garbutt, 47, will spend 11 years behind bars for the murder of Raven Campbell, who was 31 when she went missing in June 2009.

Campell’s body was discovered behind a patched-up hole in the wall of a closet in an apartment at the Harbor Hills Housing Project in Lomita, California in July 2015.

Officials determined that Campbell died of blunt force trauma to the head. A criminal complaint indicates that Garbutt used a hammer to killer her.

He then wrapped her body in a plastic bag and buried her in a makeshift grave behind the wall of the closet, according to the Daily Breeze.

Garbutt and Campbell lived in the Harbor Hills low income housing project in Lomita, California (Picture: Google Maps)

Garbutt kept Campbell’s body a secret until an anonymous tip from a family member led to the discovery of her remains six years later.

Seven months after the body was discovered, Garbutt was arrested. He had no longer been living in the apartment where the body was.

At Garbutt’s sentencing hearing this week, prosecutors said Garbutt confessed to killing Campbell because she fell and hit her head in the apartment.

He said he feared he would be blamed for her injuries, prompting him to suffocate her with a plastic bag.

Campbell’s family members at the hearing were outraged when they learned Garbutt would only be getting 11 years in jail.

He has been in jail since February 2016 and has already gotten credit for four years of his sentence.

Cynthia Campbell Kemp, Raven’s sister, said: ‘To place her in a wall, the irony is this man will probably only do about as much time as she was while she was in the wall.’

‘That’s the crime. The punishment is not just, but we’re just going to have to accept it.’
description: Randoph Garbutt, 47, will spend 11 years behind bars for the murder of Raven Campbell, who was 31 when she went missing in 2009.
